conclusion: Identify the forces and set up coordinates

A child (30 kg) sitting on a sled (10 kg), an adult pulling with force F = 100 N at angle θ = 37° above horizontal, the sled moves at constant speed, gravity acts downward, the normal force acts upward from the ground, there must be friction opposing the motion
Analyze forces in the horizontal direction: f = 80 N
Analyze forces in the vertical direction: N = 340 N
Pressure is defined as force per unit area
Calculate the pressure: The magnitude of the normal force exerted by the ground on the sled is 340 N
The magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N
